page.title: 06Education
page.content: Seamer School There have been three schools in the Seamer area.The first two schools built in 1740 & 1879 respectively were situated in the heart of Seamer. The present school built in 1969-70 is sited on the more open outskirts Seamer.The catchment area of the school is Irton,Crossgates and Seamer. There are 263 pupils with eight teachers,a secretary and the headmaster,Mr.Pratt.Many pupils participate in out of school activities such as gymnastics,football pet,science and an art club.The school is not just used for teaching,but in the evenings is used for other activities such as brownies and guides on a Monday night and the Red Cross make use of it on a Thursday night.
